setting.name: username
setting.label: User name
setting.description: The username for the SIP account.

setting.name: display_name
setting.label: Display name
setting.description: The name that will be displayed for this account on the user’s phone.

setting.name: domain
setting.label: SIP domain
setting.description: The domain for the proxy (account).

setting.name: enabled
setting.label: Enabled
setting.description: Set to true to enable the account. If you allow multiple accounts, enable and disable accounts as appropriate, to control this initial behavior (the user will be able to change it). Otherwise, leave this setting as the default.

setting.name: register
setting.label: Register
setting.description: Set to true if you want to allow the user to register with your SIP registrar, so that they can receive incoming calls.

setting.name: reregister_in_seconds
setting.label: Re-register interval
setting.description: The time interval between the application’s attempts to reregister in order to refresh the account registration (in seconds). A value of 0 means not to reregister after the initial registration. This value is placed in the “Expires” header field of the register message.

setting.name: password
setting.label: Password
setting.description: The password for the SIP account.

setting.name: authorization_username
setting.label: Authorization user name
setting.description: The authorization username for the SIP account. An authorization name is useful, for example, if you allow usernames that are short and therefore easy to guess. The authorization user name is used in place of the user name to register the account with the SIP registrar. It provides an added layer of security.

setting.name: subscribe_to_message_waiting
setting.label: Subscribe to message waiting
setting.description: Set to true to instruct the application to subscribe to be notified when there is a voicemail for the end user. When there is a voicemail, the application will display a MWI to notify the user. Set to false if your server will notify the application (without the application subscribing) when there is a voicemail for the end user, or you do not want the application to be involved in handling voicemail.

setting.name: message_waiting_maximum_time_before_resubscribe_in_seconds
setting.label: Maximum time before resubscribe
setting.description: The maximum wait time between attempts to resubscribe (in seconds). Once this maximum is reached, the application will wait this time for all subsequent attempts.

setting.name: message_waiting_minimum_time_before_resubscribe_in_seconds
setting.label: Minimum time before resubscribe
setting.description: If the resubscribe fails, the application will wait this amount of time (in seconds), then attempt to resubscribe. If the second attempt fails, the application will wait twice this time and try again, then four times this time, and so on, until resubscribe succeeds.

setting.name: message_waiting_refresh_interval_in_seconds
setting.label: Refresh interval
setting.description: The time interval between the application’s attempts to resubscribe in order to refresh the MWI information (in seconds). A value of 0 means not to resubscribe after the initial subscription.

setting.name: presence_operating_mode
setting.label: Presence mode
setting.description: Specify the operating mode for presence:

setting.name: presence_p2p_poll_time_in_seconds
setting.label: Poll time
setting.description: If Presence mode is With presence agent or Peer-to-peer, enter the polling time for presence: the time used to retry a SUBSCRIBE request should a first one be unsuccessful (in seconds).

setting.name: presence_server_refresh_interval_in_seconds
setting.label: Refresh interval
setting.description: If Presence mode is With presence agent or Peer-to-peer, enter the refresh time for presence: the interval at which the subscription must be refreshed (in seconds). This setting is the "expires=" in the SUBSCRIBE message.

setting.name: resource_list_method
setting.label: Resource list method
setting.description: The method for storing the resource list, that is, the contacts in the Contacts tab and Addresses tab. - Local: Store on the the application computer only, in the location for application data for the application. You specify the location of this folder during branding. - WebDAV: To store locally and on a remote WebDAV location. The location and login information are provided in other “resource_” the application settings. - XCAP: To store locally and on a remote XCAP location. Login information is provided in other “resource_” the application settings.

setting.name: resource_list_use_sip_credentials
setting.label: Use SIP credentials
setting.description: Set to true if the application is to log into the remote storage using the SIP login information (settings “username” and “password”). Set to false if different login information is required. Not used if Resource list method is “Local”.

setting.name: resource_lists_poll_time
setting.label: Poll time
setting.description: Used only if Resource list method is “Web DAV” (in seconds), to check if the document has changed on the remote storage.

setting.name: enable_session_timer
setting.label: Enable session timer
setting.description: A session timer is a mechanism to detect whether a call session is still active from the signalling point of view. When the timer expires, a refresh is sent from one party to the other. The timer is then reset. Set to true to enable session timer. Set to false to disable session timer; refreshes will never be sent.

setting.name: default_session_refresh_interval_in_seconds
setting.label: Default session refresh interval
setting.description: The interval for the timer, in seconds. Ignored if Enable session timer is false.

setting.name: prefered_session_fresher
setting.label: Preferred session fresher
setting.description: The party that should send the refresh (see the Enable session timer setting). The preference is not a guarantee that the refresh will be performed by the specified party. None. Valid only if enable_sesion_timer is false. Local refreshes. The local the application sends. Remote refreshes. The other party sends. UAC refreshes. The user agent client sends. UAS refreshes. The user agent server sends.

setting.name: ice_enabled
setting.label: Enable ICE
setting.description: Set to true to enable Interactive Conectivity Establishment (ICE) procedure for establishing calls.

setting.name: outbound_proxy
setting.label: Outbound proxy
setting.description: If Use outbound proxy is Always or Automatic, enter the domain name or IP address of the firewall outbound proxy.

setting.name: override_sip_listen_port
setting.label: Override SIP listen port
setting.description: Set to true to force the application to read the value in Listen SIP port. Set to false to let the application discover the listening port.

setting.name: override_stun_server
setting.label: Override STUN server
setting.description: Set to true to force the application to read the value in stun_server. Set to false if the STUN server can be discovered via the domain address Set to false if you do not provide a STUN server for your users.

setting.name: port_range_enable
setting.label: Port range enable
setting.description: Set to true to force the application to use transport ports within a specific range (as specified by Port range min and Port range max). Set to false to enable the application to use transport ports in the full standard range of 1025 to 65535.

setting.name: port_range_min
setting.label: Port range min
setting.description: If Port range enable is true, enter the port value of the lower port in the range.

setting.name: port_range_max
setting.label: Port range max
setting.description: If Port range enable is true, enter the port value of the upper port in the range.

setting.name: send_internal_ip_address
setting.label: Send internal IP address
setting.description: Set to true to send the computer’s internal IP address in the c-line in the SIP message header. Set to false to allow discovery to determine which IP address to put in the c-line.

setting.name: send_sip_keep_alive_messages
setting.label: Send SIP keep alive messages
setting.description: Set to true to send SIP keepalive messages in order to maintain a “pinhole” through your firewall for SIP messaging.

setting.name: sip_tcp_port_keep_alive_time_in_seconds
setting.label: SIP TCP port keep alive time
setting.description: Keepalive time for TCP signaling transport (in seconds). The value in this setting is used only if keep alive is enabled for the account and the transport in use for the account is TCP.

setting.name: sip_udp_port_keep_alive_time_in_seconds
setting.label: SIP UDP port keep alive time
setting.description: Keepalive time for UDP signaling transport (in seconds). The value in this setting is used only if keep alive is enabled for the account and the transport in use for the account is UDP.

setting.name: stun_server
setting.label: STUN server
setting.description: If Override STUN server is true, enter the domain name or IP address of the STUN server.

setting.name: turn_enabled
setting.label: TURN enabled
setting.description: Set to true to instruct the application to use TURN.

setting.name: turn_server
setting.label: TURN server
setting.description: Host or domain name for TURN server. Or leave blank to instruct the application to use the TURN domain to obtain the address of the TURN server.

setting.name: turn_domain
setting.label: TURN domain
setting.description: The domain for the TURN server. Leave blank to use the SIP domain.

setting.name: turn_use_sip_credentials
setting.label: Use SIP credentials for TURN
setting.description: Set to true to instruct the application to log into the TURN server using the user’s SIP user name and password. If this setting is false, the user must be provided with a separate TURN user name and password. They will enter this information in the the application account settings window.

setting.name: turn_username
setting.label: TURN username
setting.description: Username for logging on to the TURN server. Only used when Use SIP credentials for TURN is false.

setting.name: turn_password
setting.label: TURN password
setting.description: Password for logging on to the TURN server. Only used when Use SIP credentials for TURN is false.

setting.name: use_outbound_proxy
setting.label: Use outbound proxy
setting.description: Specifies whether you have a firewall outbound proxy. Enter: - Never if you do not have a firewall outbound proxy. - Always if you have a firewall outbound proxy and want the application to always send traffic to that proxy. - Automatic if you have a firewall outbound proxy and want the application to send traffic to that proxy when it detects that the the application computer is behind a firewall that is likely to have issues with SIP.

setting.name: maximum_time_before_reregistration_in_seconds
setting.label: Maximum time before re-registration
setting.description: The maximum wait time between attempts to reregister. Once this maximum is reached, the application will wait this time for all subsequent attempts.

setting.name: minimum_time_before_reregistration_in_seconds
setting.label: Minimum time before re-registration
setting.description: If the reregistration fails, the application will wait this amount of time, then attempt to reregister. If the second attempt fails, the application will wait twice this time and try again, then four times this time, and so on, until reregistration succeeds.

setting.name: use_proxy_for_outbound_calls
setting.label: Use proxy for outbound calls
setting.description: Set to true to direct outbound traffic to your proxy or your outbound proxy. This setting (a) and Override outbound proxy (b) and proxy (c) work together as follows: a b c Result F F Outbound traffic does not go via OBP. It goes directly to the target domain. - T value Outbound traffic goes via the OBP specified in setting c. T F Outbound traffic goes via the domain proxy (the domain setting).

setting.name: override_outbound_proxy
setting.label: Override outbound proxy
setting.description: True or False, see Use proxy for outbound calls for details.

setting.name: proxy
setting.label: Proxy
setting.description: The domain name, host name, or IP address of the outbound proxy. See the Use proxy for outbound calls setting for details. If empty, domain host name will be queried via DNS (NAPTR/srv) to figure out the actual proxy server.

setting.name: transport
setting.label: Transport
setting.description: The transport to use for signaling. Value must be entered in lowercase. Automatic: the application sets up the transport based on the capabilities of the network and the the application computer. The preferred method will be obtained via DNS (NAPTR/srv) queries. Encrypted: TLS will be used, in order to support encryption. TCP: This transport provides no signalling security. UDP This transport provides no signalling security. TLS: Choose this option if you want to request media encryption. The value here affects the type of signaling and media encryption that can be supported.

setting.name: enable_rinstance
setting.label: Enable rinstance
setting.description: Enables sending rinstance parameter for the contact header so that the application knows the correct “expires time” to use if multiple the application clients are runing in different locations using the same account.

setting.name: forward_always
setting.label: Forward always
setting.description: Set to true to forward incoming calls to the address specified in forward_always_uri

setting.name: forward_always_uri
setting.label: Forward always URI
setting.description: The address to use for Forward Always.

setting.name: forward_busy
setting.label: Forward busy
setting.description: Set to true to forward incoming calls to the address specified in forward_busy _uri, if another call is already established.

setting.name: forward_busy_uri
setting.label: Forward busy URI
setting.description: The address to use for Forward Busy.

setting.name: voicemail_url
setting.label: Voicemail URL
setting.description: The number to phone to conect to voicemail in order to listen to voicemail messages.
